message.content:
cs.IT, cs.CC, cs.NI, cs.SI, cs.DS

The paper discusses the performance of LDPC codes under maximum likelihood decoding on the binary erasure channel, which is a topic related to information theory (cs.IT). The paper also mentions the sparseness of the parity-check matrix, which is a characteristic of LDPC codes and is often studied in the context of coding theory (cs.CC). The comparison with Raptor codes suggests a focus on network coding (cs.NI) or information theory (cs.IT). Finally, the analysis of performance can be seen as a form of simulation or experimentation, which could fall under the categories of systems and control (cs.SI) or data structures and algorithms (cs.DS).
